articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least 35 people in a tent camp in the Gaza city of Rafah, medics said, drawing condemnation from European leaders on Monday who urged implementation of a World Court ruling to halt Israel's offensive.
articles.title: Israeli attack on Rafah tent camp draws global condemnation

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The Biden administration told Israel to take every precaution to protect civilians after a military strike in Rafah killed dozens of Palestinians, as it faced calls from some fellow Democrats to halt military shipments to Israel.
articles.title: Biden tells Israel to protect civilians after Rafah strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Monday proposed tax cuts for millions of pensioners in his latest campaign pledge, highlighting the importance of older voters in the upcoming July election.
articles.title: UK's Sunak proposes tax cuts for pensioners in new election pledge

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Iran is enriching uranium to close to weapons-grade at a steady pace while discussions aimed at improving its cooperation with the U.N. nuclear watchdog are stalled, two confidential reports by the watchdog showed on Monday.
articles.title: Iran's near-bomb-grade uranium stock grows, talks stall, IAEA reports say

articles.author: Andrew Gray, John Irish
articles.description: The European Union agreed in principle on Monday to revive an EU civilian mission at Rafah, a city in the southern Gaza Strip next to Egypt, but said it would need accords from all sides to press ahead, the bloc's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said.
articles.title: EU agrees to revive Rafah mission, Borrell criticises Israel's Netanyahu

articles.author: Steven Scheer
articles.description: Israeli-Turkish trade has weathered many bilateral diplomatic storms over the decades and stayed on course, reaching billions of dollars a year, but Israelis fear it may not survive the latest rift over the war in Gaza.
articles.title: Israeli-Turkish trade on life support as relations hit bottom

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis used a highly derogatory term towards the LGBT community as he reiterated in a closed-door meeting with Italian bishops that gay people should not be allowed to become priests, Italian media reported on Monday.
articles.title: Pope used vulgar Italian word to refer to LGBT people, Italian newspapers report

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top commander said on Monday he had signed paperwork allowing French military instructors to visit Ukrainian training centres soon.
articles.title: Ukraine commander says French military instructors to visit Ukrainian training centres

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazil's finance ministry plans to raise the minimum cigarette price to offset losses from tax benefits granted to companies in some sectors and small municipalities, a government source told Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Brazil plans to raise minimum cigarette price, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peru's attorney general's office on Monday presented a constitutional complaint against President Dina Boluarte in a case involving her use of luxury watches, which has become a national scandal.
articles.title: Peru's president faces constitutional complaint in Rolex case
